text.value: Is this your name? If not, tap here to learn how to set the Username.

Setting the Username
⋮ > Settings > User and device > Form metadata > Username
Name format
The Username should be your full Given and Surname, e.g. Joe Bloggs. Avoid nicknames, abbreviations, or multiple names. Provide only and completely the name of the person who is solely or mainly responsible for data entry. Team members go into a separate field in form "Site Visit Start".
After updating the Username
Exit this form with the device's back button and "ignore changes", then fill it again to see the updated Username. Subsequent forms will record this name.
Tap here to learn about available options.

Hybrid step 1: Start here, then continue on paper
Create a minimal form here to capture the hard bits (location and time) and link to a paper datasheet via a datasheet ID, then continue data capture on paper. When you have time, find this form in "Edit saved forms" via the datasheet ID and select "Hybrid step 2" to backfill the digital record from paper.
Hybrid step 2: Backfill from paper
With the paper datasheet in your hand, you have found this form from "Edit saved forms" via the datasheet ID. Select this option to backfill the paper datasheet into this digital form.
Paperless: Continue here
Enter the entire record into this form and avoid the use of any paper datasheet altogether.
Paper: Transcribe a complete paper datasheet
Some records are captured entirely on paper, including location and time. There is no initial digital form. Select this option to transcribe a paper datasheet. Location and time can be backfilled here and set to values other than your current position and the current time.
Hybrid step 1: Start here, continue on paper
Paper: Transcribe a complete paper datasheet
The datasheet ID becomes part of the saved form's name and links this record, until entirely backfilled, to the paper datasheet.
Person applying most tags and measuring.
Once you proceed in the form, the "Handler" fields will be pre-filled with this name. You can still change each handler field as required later.
Nest or last location of turtle activity. Tap navigation arrow top right to view in decimal degrees.

Accuracy
You can save the point as soon as an accuracy is shown. If the accuracy falls below 5m, the widget will auto-save. If the accuracy stalls above the auto-save threshold, it is OK to save. Aim for an accuracy below 20m.
Speed
If the GPS consistently takes more than 10s to auto-save, let your coordinator know.
Warm-up
This form warms up the GPS by capturing a silent initial location, which pops up a "toast" style warning about being tracked. It is OK to ignore this warning.
If nest or turtle location is not available, record your current location.
Use as nesting time on datasheet
This timestamp is read-only and only shown for backfilling a paper datasheet. You are not supposed or required to edit it here.
Lat in signed decimal degrees WGS84 if originally captured on handheld GPS.

Signed means the negative sign for southern latitudes must be entered by you.
Type the minus sign by double tapping the ".-" key if you're on a "green" Samsung tablet.
Lon in decimal degrees WGS84 if originally captured on handheld GPS.
If no GPS coords available, pick a credible point on the map

Pan and zoom
This map will auto-zoom to your current location once GPS has a fix. You can pan and zoom elsewhere, then reset the map with the crosshair icon.
Layers
Select an offline reference layer for the intended fieldwork location from the layer button. The map will remember chosen layers across all forms. These layers provide aerial imagery as well as known site names and boundaries.
Capture a new point
Long-press any point on the map to record a point. You can replace a captured point by long-pressing another location until you're happy with the placement. The plus-marker icon captures your current position.
Which point?
The point can be your current position, but it doesn't have to be. The widget will be used if we want to know a location other than your own, e.g. which site you intend to survey, or the remote location of an incident.
Save and exit
Press the save button at the lower right.
Date and time of turtle encounter

The complete PIT tag ID, whitespace allowed.
Leave blank if no tag.

Additional PIT and Flipper tags can be added at the end of this form. Use paper to quickly write down tag IDs if it's getting hectic.
You can use voice to text. Whitespace will be ignored.
Left PIT tag ID must be 15 digits
You must change this if the PIT tag is present.

new tag applied
"New" refers to the new association between tag and animal. The tag was not yet on or in the animal before you encountered it.
old tag found in animal
"Old" stands for an existing tag that was already in the animal before you encountered it.
new tag applied, no read, assumed lost
If a newly applied tag does not register in the PIT tag scanner after application, we assume it is lost.
no PIT tag
The default if no PIT was found or applied.
new tag applied, no read, assumed lost

The complete PIT tag ID, whitespace allowed.
Leave blank if no tag.
Right PIT tag ID must be 15 digits
You must change this if the PIT tag is present.

new tag applied
"New" refers to the new association between tag and animal. The tag was not yet on or in the animal before you encountered it.
old tag found in animal
"Old" stands for an existing tag that was already in the animal before you encountered it.
new tag applied, no read, assumed lost
If a newly applied tag does not register in the PIT tag scanner after application, we assume it is lost.
no PIT tag
The default if no PIT was found or applied.
new tag applied, no read, assumed lost

The complete PIT tag ID, whitespace allowed.
Leave blank if no tag.
Third PIT tag ID must be 15 digits
You must change this if the PIT tag is present.

new tag applied
"New" refers to the new association between tag and animal. The tag was not yet on or in the animal before you encountered it.
old tag found in animal
"Old" stands for an existing tag that was already in the animal before you encountered it.
new tag applied, no read, assumed lost
If a newly applied tag does not register in the PIT tag scanner after application, we assume it is lost.
no PIT tag
The default if no PIT was found or applied.
new tag applied, no read, assumed lost
PIT tag location in turtle body.
Absence or presence of tag scars.
Tag scars are an important hint whether this animal has been processed before. Aim to provide this information if possible. If this field is not filled in, it is handled as "did not check".
front left flipper, 1st scale from body
front left flipper, 2nd scale from body
front left flipper, 3rd scale from body
front right flipper, 1st scale from body
front right flipper, 2nd scale from body
front right flipper, 3rd scale from body
Select all locations of tags you couldn't read in time.
front left flipper, 1st scale from body
front left flipper, 2nd scale from body
front left flipper, 3rd scale from body
front right flipper, 1st scale from body
front right flipper, 2nd scale from body
front right flipper, 3rd scale from body
Leave blank if NA. Capitalisation and whitespace do not matter.
Type the tag ID without whitespace to prevent auto-correct. If choosing "WB" from auto-complete suggestions, the introduced whitespace can be kept.
Change if this flipper tag is present.
The tag status only applies if a tag ID is given.
old tag found on animal and reclinched
front left flipper, 1st scale from body
front left flipper, 2nd scale from body
front left flipper, 3rd scale from body
front right flipper, 1st scale from body
front right flipper, 2nd scale from body
front right flipper, 3rd scale from body
Was the tag securely fixed after the encounter?
Yes if already secure, reclinched, or applied correctly. No if still loose when turtle left.
E.g. barnacles cover tag ID, barnacles removed
Show tag ID if conditions allow to take a clear photo.
Change if this flipper tag is present.
The tag status only applies if a tag ID is given.

Yes if already secure, reclinched, or applied correctly. No if still loose when turtle left.

Was the tag securely fixed after the encounter?
Yes if already secure, reclinched, or applied correctly. No if still loose when turtle left.
Show tag ID if conditions allow to take a clear photo.
Leave blank if no Biopsy was taken.
Any clarification or additional detail. Additional samples can be recorded later.
Photo of biopsy sample ID only if possible.
Show biopsy ID if conditions allow to take a clear photo quickly. Do not bother with biopsy labels inside vials. The photo can be taken on the next morning.
CCL min in mm, standard for Flatbacks
CCL must be positive and below 3 m (3000 mm)
CCL max in mm, Hawksbill only
CCL must be positive and below 3 m (3000 mm)
CCW must be positive and below 2 m (2000 mm)
MHW must be positive and below 1 m (1000 mm)
TC must be positive and below 1 m (1000 mm)
TPmust be positive and below 1 m (1000 mm)
TV must be positive and below 1 m (1000 mm)
What is the most likely age and maturity of the turtle?
"Present" unlocks additional screens later in this form.
"Yes" unlocks additional screens later in this form.
Nest with eggs - witnessed egg drop
Nest unsure of eggs - found covered up nest mound
Unsure if nest - can't tell whether nest mound present or not
No nest - witnessed aborted nest or found track with no nest
If nest tag found or deployed, the date on the tag.

The physical tag label in/on the nest should include a turtle tag (as already recorded earlier in this form, not repeated here), the date of the nesting event, and a nest tag ID.
A typical tag would be WA12345\_2021-01-01\_AB01.
Leave blank if no nest tag found or deployed.

Format: Tagger initials and running number, e.g. AB01.
Omit turtle tag and date here but include on physical nest tag.

Data loggers

Any data loggers deployed or collected?
Loggers are devices placed into the nest.
"Yes" unlocks additional screens later in this form.
Yes, let me add logger details
Only record damages or injuries which impact nesting success, or will help re-identify a turtle.
How recent does the damage appear?
Show entire feature in good detail if photo possible.
If this form is backfilled from a paper datasheet, you can take a photo of the hand-drawn damage sketch.
The alphanumeric tag or sample ID. To delete this group, go to hierarchy view and tap the trash icon.
old tag found on or in animal
old tag found on animal and reclinched
new tag applied, no read, assumed lost

front left flipper, 3rd scale from body

Was the tag securely fixed after the encounter?
Yes if already secure, reclinched, or applied correctly. No if still loose when turtle left.
Photo of tag or sample ID
Show tag ID if visible or sample ID.
The logger ID. To delete this group, go to hierarchy view and tap the trash icon.
Show logger ID if conditions allow to take a clear photo.
Capture entire datasheet holding device in portrait orientation.
Tilt the device slightly up so that the camera stays in portrait orientation.
Capture rear side of datasheet if marked.
Any clarifications on datasheets or further observations?
